instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hello everyone.

I have this plate that turns on but when it turns off after a while, it no longer turns on.

I have to disconnect the battery and then it turns on.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage is 12.10V with battery connected.

With the 87W cable connected, the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage goes up to 12.70V.

Disconnected from the current the machine turned on with the battery connected, the voltage is 12.10V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: What are the values on the thb port?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Do you get 20V on all USB-C ports, without battery connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
resolved. Note that the machine when closing the screen did not return the image and turned off. Check lined <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.3V

resistors good.

Value in Diode pin 2 of the resistor 5252 value 2.293 abnormal.

Compared to another plate the value was 0.478

I had to make a jumper and the value returned to normal.

Now the machine turns on when lifting the screen.

THANK YOU!

Let it stay for future repairs.
